author: Robert Schumann
content: When you play, never mind who listens to you.

author: Robert Schumann
content: To send light into the darkness of men’s hearts – such is the duty of the artist.

author: Robert Schumann
content: Talent works, genius creates.

author: Robert Schumann
content: In order to compose, all you need to do is remember a tune that nobody else has thought of.

author: Robert Schumann
content: The principal mark of genius is not perfection, but originality.

author: Robert Schumann
content: We may be sure that a genius like Mozart, were he born today, would write concertos like Chopin and not like Mozart.

author: Robert Schumann
content: You write to become immortal, or because the piano happens to be open, or you’ve looked into a pair of beautiful eyes.

author: Robert Schumann
content: That first concept is alway the most naturally and best. The mind errs, the emotion never.

author: Robert Schumann
content: If we were all determined to play the first violin we should never have an ensemble. therefore, respect every musician in his proper place.

author: Robert Schumann
content: Nothing right can be accomplished in art without enthusiasm.

author: Robert Schumann
content: A fiery, good beginner always stands higher than a master in mediocrity...

author: Robert Schumann
content: “It is the curse of talent that, although it labors with greater steadiness and perseverance than genius, it does not reach its goal, while genius already on the summit of the ideal, gazes laughingly about.

author: Robert Schumann
content: Endeavour to play easy pieces well and with elegance; that is better than to play difficult pieces badly.

author: Robert Schumann
content: We shouldn’t repeat the same for ages on end, but look into the new as well.

author: Robert Schumann
content: Remember, there are more people in the world than yourself. Be modest! You have not yet invented nor thought anything which others have not thought or invented before. And should you really have done so, consider it a gift of heaven which you are to share with others.

author: Robert Schumann
content: By means of industry and perseverance you will rise higher and higher.

author: Robert Schumann
content: Look deeply into life, and study it as diligently as the other arts and sciences.

author: Frédéric Chopin
content: Simplicity is the final achievement.

author: Frédéric Chopin
content: Put all your soul into it, play the way you feel!

author: Frédéric Chopin
content: Time is the best of critics; and patience the best of teachers.
